ruleset.name: Code Style
ruleset.description: Rules which enforce a specific coding style.

rule.name: AssignmentInOperand
rule.description: Avoid assignments in operands; this can make code more complicated and harder to read. This is sometime indicative of the bug where the assignment operator '=' was used instead of the equality operator '=='.

property.name: xpath
allowIf
property.description: Allow assignment within the conditional expression of an if statement

property.name: allowFor
property.description: Allow assignment within the conditional expression of a for statement

property.name: allowWhile
property.description: Allow assignment within the conditional expression of a while statement

property.name: allowTernary
property.description: Allow assignment within the conditional expression of a ternary operator

property.name: allowTernaryResults
property.description: Allow assignment within the result expressions of a ternary operator

property.name: allowIncrementDecrement
property.description: Allow increment or decrement operators within the conditional expression of an if, for, or while statement

rule.name: ForLoopsMustUseBraces
rule.message: Avoid using 'for' statements without curly braces
rule.description: Avoid using 'for' statements without using curly braces.

rule.name: IfElseStmtsMustUseBraces
rule.message: Avoid using 'if...else' statements without curly braces
rule.description: Avoid using if..else statements without using curly braces.

rule.name: IfStmtsMustUseBraces
rule.message: Avoid using if statements without curly braces
rule.description: Avoid using if statements without using curly braces.

rule.name: NoElseReturn
rule.description:
The else block in a if-else-construct is unnecessary if the `if` block contains a return. Then the content of the else block can be put outside.
See also: <http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-else-return>

rule.name: UnnecessaryBlock
rule.description: An unnecessary Block is present. Such Blocks are often used in other languages to introduce a new variable scope. Blocks do not behave like this in ECMAScipt, and using them can be misleading. Considering removing this unnecessary Block.

property.name: xpath

rule.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
rule.example: var x = 1; // Ok var y = (1 + 1); // Ok var z = ((1 + 1)); // Bad

rule.name: UnreachableCode
rule.message: A ''return'', ''break'', ''continue'', or ''throw'' statement should be the last in a block.
rule.description: A 'return', 'break', 'continue', or 'throw' statement should be the last in a block. Statements after these will never execute. This is a bug, or extremely poor style.

rule.name: WhileLoopsMustUseBraces
rule.message: Avoid using 'while' statements without curly braces
rule.description: Avoid using 'while' statements without using curly braces.
